title: AMD Unveils Next-Generation AI Processors for Consumer PCs and Gaming at CES 2026

paragraphs.content: **AMD has announced its Ryzen AI 400 Series and Ryzen AI PRO 400 Series processors at CES 2026, marking a significant push into AI-accelerated computing for mainstream consumers.**The new chips deliver up to 60 TOPS (tera operations per second) NPU performance, enabling faster content creation, smoother multitasking, and enhanced gaming experiences compared to rival offerings.First systems will ship in January 2026, with broader availability from major OEMs including Acer, ASUS, Dell, HP, GIGABYTE, and Lenovo beginning in Q1 2026.AMD positions these processors as the foundation of its "AI Everywhere, for Everyone" strategy, expanding AI capabilities beyond data centers to consumer laptops and compact desktops.

primarySource.name: TechCrunch AI
primarySource.title: AMD unveils new AI PC processors for general use and gaming at CES

additionalSources.name: amd
additionalSources.title: AMD unveils new AI PC processors for general use and gaming at CES

paragraphs.content: Complementing the mainstream Ryzen AI lineup, AMD also unveiled the **Ryzen 7 9850X3D**, a gaming-focused desktop processor featuring second-generation 3D V-Cache technology optimized for high-frame-rate gaming and content creation.The company introduced its Ryzen AI Halo developer platform, a compact mini-PC equipped with the Ryzen AI Max+ processor, designed to support local AI model inference up to 200 billion parameters.Additionally, AMD announced Ryzen AI Embedded Series processors for edge AI applications in automotive, healthcare, and robotics, demonstrating the breadth of its AI processor strategy.These announcements reflect AMD's ambition to compete directly with Intel across consumer and professional segments while establishing leadership in local AI deployment.

primarySource.name: youtube
primarySource.title: AMD unveils new AI PC processors for general use and gaming at CES

additionalSources.name: amd
additionalSources.title: AMD unveils new AI PC processors for general use and gaming at CES

sections.title: Ryzen AI 400 Series Specifications and Performance Claims

paragraphs.content: The Ryzen AI 400 Series processors feature 12 CPU cores and 24 threads, a significant upgrade from the 2024 Ryzen AI 300 Series.AMD claims these chips deliver 1.3x faster multitasking performance and 1.7x faster content creation speeds compared to competitors, making them particularly appealing to creative professionals and power users.The 60 TOPS NPU provides efficient acceleration for AI-driven workloads including local inference, cloud-to-client AI scaling, and application-specific tasks with full AMD ROCm platform support.The Pro variant adds enterprise-grade security and manageability features for business deployments.

primarySource.name: amd
primarySource.title: AMD unveils new AI PC processors for general use and gaming at CES

additionalSources.name: pcper
additionalSources.title: AMD unveils new AI PC processors for general use and gaming at CES

paragraphs.content: The Ryzen AI Max+ 392 variant offers a particularly powerful configuration for compact desktop systems, featuring up to 5.0 GHz boost clock speeds, 76MB of cache, and integrated Radeon 8060S graphics with 40 compute units.With a configurable power envelope ranging from 45 to 120 watts, these processors balance performance and thermal efficiency for diverse form factors.The 50 TOPS NPU in the Max+ variant enables local execution of large language models, eliminating reliance on cloud services for certain AI tasks and reducing latency for real-time applications.Desktop-class graphics capabilities allow these processors to support both AI acceleration and gaming workloads simultaneously, expanding their appeal beyond specialized use cases.

AMD's Ryzen 7 9850X3D represents a dedicated gaming processor built on the Zen 5 architecture with 8 cores, 16 threads, and up to 5.6 GHz boost performance.The processor features 104MB of total cache, including second-generation 3D V-Cache technology that AMD claims delivers up to 27% better gaming performance than Intel's Core Ultra 9 285K flagship.The 3D V-Cache architecture simulates physical light behavior in ray-tracing workloads, enhancing video game graphics quality without sacrificing frame rates or responsiveness.Systems powered by the Ryzen 7 9850X3D will be available from major OEMs and retail partners starting Q1 2026.

The gaming-focused processor addresses consumer demand for high-performance desktop processors that excel in both gaming and content creation workflows.AMD's emphasis on low-latency performance and frame consistency positions the 9850X3D against Intel's premium gaming offerings, particularly for demanding titles and streaming scenarios.The chip's integration of advanced cooling requirements and power delivery needs reflects its position as a high-end enthusiast processor rather than a mainstream option.This tiered approach—pairing consumer AI acceleration with gaming-specific architectures—allows AMD to address distinct market segments within the CES 2026 announcements.
